questions.question_text:
The sales team at Universal Containers has asked the administrator to build functionality to automatically update the account checkbox field ‘Opportunity Created’ to checked when at least one related opportunity has been created.

What feature should the administrator use to build this functionality?

discussion.content: C:Salesforce has started to move away from using workflow rules and is instead encouraging the use of record-triggered flows or process builder. So, a record-triggered flow could also be used to build the functionality to automatically update the account checkbox field 'Opportunity Created' to checked when at least one related opportunity has been created.

comments.content: but flows run in ascending order...the highest "priority"" should mean the lowest order...

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Based on this - https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=release-notes.rn_automate_flow_builder_trigger_order.htm&release=236&type=5 - the order of execution for RT flows in one object CAN be guaranteed.
It's just the "assign the highest "priority"" thing that makes me cautious. Assuming that the word priority is substituted for "trigger order", C would be correct.

D:D. The order in which those flows are executed is not guaranteed.

When multiple record-triggered flows are defined on an object, the order of execution is not guaranteed. Salesforce determines the order of execution based on various factors, such as the type of event, whether the flows are before or after triggers, and whether they are part of the same managed package. To ensure the correct order of execution, it is recommended to consolidate the logic into a single flow or use a combination of before and after triggers to handle the logic.

questions.question_text:
Ursa Major Solar’s administrator has configured multiple record-triggered flows to run before or after the record is saved on the Account object.

What should the administrator consider when a record-triggered flow executes first?

choices.A: The flow with the shortest execution time will execute first.
choices.B: The flow with the longest execution time will execute first.
choices.C: Assign the highest priority to the record-triggered flow which should execute first.
choices.D: The order in which those flows are executed is not guaranteed.

discussion.content: The correct answer is C. Setup Audit Trail. The Setup Audit Trail tracks changes made to the setup area of Salesforce, including changes to profiles, and can be used to see who made the change and when it was made. Field History Tracking is used to track changes made to specific fields on a record, while Analytic Snapshot and Historical Trending are used for reporting and trend analysis.

questions.question_text:
As part of their yearly audit, the compliance team at Cloud Kicks would like to track when a user’s profile has been changed and who changed the data.

What should the administrator review to meet this requirement?

Cloud Kicks needs to automate several updates to lead records and update unrelated records. Select changes should happen every time a record is created or updated, but other changes should only happen when the record is updated.

Which two options should the administrator use to automate these updates? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Use a Decision element with the "Only if the record that triggered the flow to run is updated to meet the condition requirements” option.
choices.C: Create a Process Builder that runs when a record is changed.
choices.D: Use "formula evaluates to true” workflow rule with the ISCHANGED function to make changes when the record is updated.
choices.A: Create a flow that runs when a record is created or updated.

discussion.content: Why not B, The answer should be A,B

A. Create a flow that runs when a record is created or updated.
C. Create a Process Builder that runs when a record is changed.

Both flows and Process Builder can be used to automate updates to records when they are created or updated, as well as to specify criteria for updates that only need to happen when the record is updated. The "Only if the record that triggered the flow to run is updated to meet the condition requirements” option is specific to flows and can be used to further refine the criteria for certain updates. The "formula evaluates to true” option is specific to workflow rules and can also be used to specify criteria for updates that should only happen when the record is updated.

choices.C: Update Knowledge to auto-search the case’s subject.
choices.D: Delete and remove old Knowledge articles.

This would help service reps quickly find the most relevant articles to their customer's needs.
